\newcounter{InstructionCounter}
\insndocsection{ALU arithmetic instructions}
The \rvex{} ALU has a 32-bit adder for arithmetic. Some exotic instructions are
available to make efficient multiplications by small constants and to speed up
software divisions.
\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:ADD}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{add $r0.d = $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{add $r0.d = $r0.x, imm}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}
 & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & \\
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize y} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize } & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{9}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize imm} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Performs a 32-bit addition. Notice that \insn{ADD} instructions may be used as
move or load immediate operations when \code{x} is set to 0. While the \insn{OR}
instruction is often used instead, there is no functional difference between the
two when used inthis way.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.d = $r0.x + [$r0.y|imm];
\end{lstlisting}

\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:SH1ADD}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{sh1add $r0.d = $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{sh1add $r0.d = $r0.x, imm}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}

\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize y} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize } & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{9}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize imm} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Performs a 32-bit addition. \code{$r0.x} is first left-shifted by one.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.d = ($r0.x << 1) + [$r0.y|imm];
\end{lstlisting}

\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:SH2ADD}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{sh2add $r0.d = $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{sh2add $r0.d = $r0.x, imm}}}

\noindent Performs a 32-bit addition. \code{$r0.x} is first left-shifted by two.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.d = ($r0.x << 2) + [$r0.y|imm];
\end{lstlisting}

\end{lstlisting}

\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:SUB}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{sub $r0.d = $r0.y, $r0.x}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{sub $r0.d = imm, $r0.x}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}
 & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & \\
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize y} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize } & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{9}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize imm} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Performs a 32-bit subtraction. Note that, unlike all other instructions, the
immediate must be specified first. This allows \insn{SUB} to be used to subtract
a register from an immediate.

Notice that \insn{SUB} reduces to two's complement negation when \code{x} or
\code{imm} equal zero.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.d = [$r0.y|imm] + $r0.x;
\end{lstlisting}

\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:ADDCG}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{addcg $r0.d, $b0.bd = $b0.bs, $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}
 & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & \\
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize bs} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize y} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize bd} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Primitive for additions of integers wider than 32 bits. Addition is performed by
first setting a scratch branch register to false using \insn{NEQ} for the carry
input. Then \insn{ADDCG} can be used to add up words together one by one with
increasing significance, using the scratch branch register for the carry chain.

Subtractions can be performed by setting the carry input to 1 using \insn{EQ}
and ones-complementing one of the inputs using \insn{XOR}.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
long long tmp = $r0.x + $r0.y + ($b0.bs ? 1 : 0);
$r0.d = (int)tmp;
$b0.bd = (tmp & 0x100000000) != 0;
\end{lstlisting}

\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:DIVS}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{divs $r0.d, $b0.bd = $b0.bs, $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}
 & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & \\
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize bs} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize y} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize bd} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Primitive for integer divisions, used in conjunction with \insn{ADDCG}.
\todo[inline]{Figure out how divisions work so it can be explained here.}

Notice that \insn{DIVS} reduces to rotate left by one through a branch register
when \code{y} is zero. This may be used for for shift left by one
operations on integers wider than 32 bits.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
int tmp = ($r0.x << 1) | ($b0.bs ? 1 : 0);
bool flag = ($r0.x & 0x80000000) != 0;
$r0.d = flag ? (tmp + $r0.y) : (tmp - $r0.y);
$b0.bd = flag;
\end{lstlisting}

\insndocsection{ALU barrel shifter instructions}
The \rvex{} ALU includes a barrel shifter. It should be noted that the shift
amount input to the barrel shifter is 8-bit unsigned, not 32-bit as one might
expect. That is, the upper 24 bits of the shift amount are discarded, and for
instance a left shift by a negative amount will \emph{not} simply result in a
right shift.
\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:SHL}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{shl $r0.d = $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{shl $r0.d = $r0.x, imm}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}
 & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & \\
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize y} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize } & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{9}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize imm} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Performs a left-shift operation. Zeros are shifted in from the right.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.d = $r0.x << [$r0.y|imm];
\end{lstlisting}

\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:SHR}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{shr $r0.d = $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{shr $r0.d = $r0.x, imm}}}

\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Performs a signed right-shift operation. That is, the sign bit of \code{$r0.x} is
shifted in from the left.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.d = $r0.x >> [$r0.y|imm];
\end{lstlisting}

\insndocsection{ALU bitwise instructions}
The \rvex{} ALU supports a subset of bitwise operations in a single cycle.
\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:AND}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{and $r0.d = $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{and $r0.d = $r0.x, imm}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}

\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Performs a bitwise \code{AND} operation.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.d = $r0.x & [$r0.y|imm];
\end{lstlisting}

\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:ANDC}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{andc $r0.d = $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{andc $r0.d = $r0.x, imm}}}

\noindent\footnotesize

\insndocsection{ALU single-bit instructions}
The \rvex{} ALU supports several bitfield operations in a single cycle. Note
that the bit selection logic follows the same rules as the shift amount in the
barrel shifter. That is, only the least significant byte of the bit selection
operand is used to select the bit, the rest is ignored.
\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:SBIT}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{sbit $r0.d = $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{sbit $r0.d = $r0.x, imm}}}

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]

\end{lstlisting}

$r0.d = ($r0.x & (1 << [$r0.y|imm])) != 0;
\end{lstlisting}

\insndocsection{ALU boolean instructions}
As well as supporting many bitwise operations, the \rvex{} ALU also supports
some boolean operations in a single cycle. The boolean operations are defined in
the same way as C boolean operations are defined. That is, the value 0
represents false, and any other value represents true.
\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:ANDL}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{andl $r0.d = $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{andl $r0.d = $r0.x, imm}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}

\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize y} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize } & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{9}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize imm} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\

\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Performs a boolean \code{AND} operation and stores the result in an integer
register.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.d = $r0.x && [$r0.y|imm];
\end{lstlisting}

\insndocsection{ALU compare instructions}
The \rvex{} ALU supports all 32-bit possible integer comparison operations in a
single cycle. The immediate version of \insn{CMPNE} that writes to a branch
register is used to load an immediate branch register.
\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:CMPEQ}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{cmpeq $r0.d = $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{cmpeq $r0.d = $r0.x, imm}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}

\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize y} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize } & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\

\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{9}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize imm} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\

\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Determines whether the first operand is not equal to the second operand and
stores the result in an integer register.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.d = $r0.x != [$r0.y|imm];
\end{lstlisting}

\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:CMPNE}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{cmpne $b0.bd = $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{cmpne $b0.bd = $r0.x, imm}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}

\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Determines whether the first operand is not equal to the second operand and
stores the result in a branch register.

Notice that the immediate version of \insn{CMPNE} reduces to a load immediate
operation for branch registers when \code{x} is zero.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$b0.bd = $r0.x != [$r0.y|imm];
\end{lstlisting}

\insndocsection{ALU selection instructions}
The \rvex{} ALU has single-cycle instructions for conditional moves and
computation of the minimum and maximum of two integer values.
\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:SLCT}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{slct $r0.d = $b0.bs, $r0.x, $r0.y}}}

\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{slct $r0.d = $b0.bs, $r0.x, imm}}}

\noindent Conditional move.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.d = $b0.bs ? $r0.x : [$r0.y|imm];
\end{lstlisting}

\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Conditional move, with operands swapped with respect to \insn{SLCT}.

Notice that the immediate version of \insn{SLCTF} reduces to a move from a
branch register to an integer register when \code{x} is 0 and \code{y} is 1.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.d = $b0.bs ? [$r0.y|imm] : $r0.x;
\end{lstlisting}

\insndocsection{ALU type conversion instructions}
The \rvex{} ALU is capable of supporting typecasts from 32-bit integers to
16-bit and 8-bit integers in a single cycle.

\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\

\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize d} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{9}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize } & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent This operations counts the number of leading zeros in the operand. That is, the
value 0x80000000 returns 0 and the value 0 returns 32.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
unsigned int in = $r0.x;
int out = 32;
while (in) {
  in >>= 1;
  out--;
}
$r0.d = out;
\end{lstlisting}

\noindent Software trap. The first parameter is the trap argument, while the second
parameter is the trap cause byte.

\insndocsection{Multiply instructions}
\rvex{} pipelanes may be design-time configured to contain a multiplication
unit. This unit supports 16x16 and 16x32 multiplications.

In the default pipeline configuration, these instructions are pipelined by
two cycles. That is, the result of a multiply instruction is not available yet
in the subsequent instruction.

\todo[inline]{Properly document the multiply instructions. This is a bit of a
pain due to the fact that they make no sense to me at all.}

\insndocsection{Memory instructions}
Some \rvex{} pipelanes have a memory unit. The memory unit supports byte,
halfword and word operations. Sign or zero extension is part of the byte and
halfword load instructions.

The addressing mode is always register $+$ immediate. Note that attempts to read
misaligned memory locations will fail with a \trap{MISALIGNED_ACCESS} trap.

In the default pipeline configuration, these instructions are pipelined by
two cycles. That is, the result of a memory load instruction is not available
yet in the subsequent instruction. However, the current cache and core guarantee
that a memory write to address $x$ immediately followed by a memory read from
address $x$ returns the newly written value.
\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:LDW}

\noindent Loads a byte from memory. The result is written to the entire branch register
file at once. This is intended to improve context switching performance
somewhat.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
char tmp = *(char*)($r0.x + imm);
$b0.0 = tmp & 1;
$b0.1 = tmp & 2;
$b0.2 = tmp & 4;
$b0.3 = tmp & 8;
$b0.4 = tmp & 16;
$b0.5 = tmp & 32;
$b0.6 = tmp & 64;
$b0.7 = tmp & 128;
\end{lstlisting}

\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize } & \multicolumn{6}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize x} & \multicolumn{9}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize imm} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\end{tabular}

\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Store word in memory, from link register.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
*(int*)($r0.x + imm) = $l0.0;
\end{lstlisting}

\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\

\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Store byte in memory, from branch register file.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
char tmp = $b0.0;
tmp |= $b0.1 << 1
tmp |= $b0.2 << 2
tmp |= $b0.3 << 3
tmp |= $b0.4 << 4
tmp |= $b0.5 << 5
tmp |= $b0.6 << 6
tmp |= $b0.7 << 7
*(char*)($r0.x + imm) = tmp
\end{lstlisting}

\insndocsection{Branch instructions}
The highest-indexed pipelane in every \rvex{} system (i.e., the pipelane that
the last syllable in a bundle maps to) contains a branch unit. This unit
supports the flow control operations outlined below.

Branch offsets are signed immediates relative to the next program counter
(\code{PC+1}). Because there are certain alignment requirements to program
counters, the lower two or three bits of the offset are not actually included
in the bitfield. Whether this value is two or three depends on the value of the
\code{BRANCH_OFFS_SHIFT} constant defined in \code{core_intIface_pkg.vhd}; it
is three by default. It must be set to two to support branching to the start of
any bundle when stop bits are fully enabled. This must then also be updated in
the assembler.

Note that branch offsets and the stack adjust immediate are not eligible for
long immediate instructions.
\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:GOTO}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{goto offs}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}
 & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & \\
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\

\end{lstlisting}

\noindent Branches to the address in \code{$l0.0} unconditionally, while storing \code{PC+1}
in the link register. In other words, it essentially swaps \code{PC+1} and
\code{$l0.0}. This is used for dynamic function calls or calls to functions that
cannot be reached using the branch offset immediate method.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
unsigned int tmp = $l0.0;
$l0.0 = PCP1;
PCP1 = tmp;
\end{lstlisting}

instruction performs no operation if \code{$b0.bs} is false.

\end{lstlisting}

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
PCP1 += $b0.bs ? 0 : offs;
\end{lstlisting}

\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:RETURN}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{return $r0.1 = $r0.1, stackadj, $l0.0}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}
 & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & \\
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{19}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize stackadj} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize } & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Returns from a function by branching to \code{$l0.0} unconditionally, while adding
\code{stackadj} to \code{$r0.1}. \code{stackadj} is interpreted as a signed immediate. This
allows final stack pointer adjustment and returning to be done with a single
syllable.

Notice that this instruction is identical to \insn{IGOTO}, except for the fact
that \insn{IGOTO} does not access \code{$r0.1}.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.1 += stackadj;
PCP1 = $l0.0;
\end{lstlisting}

\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:RFI}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{rfi $r0.1 = $r0.1, stackadj}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}
 & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & \\
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{19}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize stackadj} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize } & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Returns from a trap service routine by branching to \creg{TP} unconditionally
and restoring \creg{SCCR} to \creg{CCR}, while adding \code{stackadj} to \code{$r0.1}.
\code{stackadj} is interpreted as a signed immediate. This allows final stack pointer
adjustment and returning to be done with a single syllable.

\begin{lstlisting}[numbers=none, basicstyle=\ttfamily\footnotesize, language=C++]
$r0.1 += stackadj;
CR_CCR = CR_SCCR;
PCP1 = CR_TP;
\end{lstlisting}

\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:STOP}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{stop }}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}
 & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & \\
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{22}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize } & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent Causes a \trap{STOP} trap to occur during execution of the next instruction.
The \trap{STOP} trap will cause the B flag in \creg{DCR} to be set, which will
stop execution. Thus, the processor will be stopped after the bundle in which
the \insn{STOP} instruction resides is executed.

\insndocsection{Long immediate instructions}

\vskip 10pt
\noindent\begin{minipage}{\textwidth}
\refstepcounter{InstructionCounter}\label{opc:LIMMH}
\noindent\textbf{\footnotesize\texttt{\detokenize{limmh tgt, imm}}}

\noindent\footnotesize
\begin{tabular}{*{32}{@{}p{0.03125 \textwidth}}@{}}
 & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & \\
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny31} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny30} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny29} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny28} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny27} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny26} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny25} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny24} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny23} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny22} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny21} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny20} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny19} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny18} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny17} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny16} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny15} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny14} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny13} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny12} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny11} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny10} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny9} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny8} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}}{\tiny7} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny6} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny5} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny4} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny3} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny2} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}}{\tiny1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{}|}{\tiny0}\\
\cline{1-32}
\multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny 1} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{1}{ @{}c@{} }{\tiny 0} & \multicolumn{3}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny tgt} & \multicolumn{23}{|@{}c@{} }{\scriptsize imm} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{} }{\tiny S} & \multicolumn{1}{|@{}c@{}|}{\scriptsize }\\
\cline{1-32}
\end{tabular}
\normalsize
\end{minipage}\vskip 10pt
\noindent This special instruction forwards \code{imm} to lane \code{tgt}. Actually, only
the least significant bit of \code{tgt} is used by the processor, to distinguish
between the two possible long immediate forwarding paths. Refer to
Section~\ref{sec:core-ug-isa-syl-classes-limm} for more information.
